p: In many countries existing social safety nets were insufficient to absorb the socioeconomic impacts of the pandemic. This is illustrated by the rapidly growing number of countries that are expanding or introducing new social protection measures. For example, Gentilini et al. (2020) found that in the first half of 2020 nearly 195 countries have implemented at least some type of social protection measures estimated to reach 1.7 billion people, showing a rapid increase of such measures during the COVID-19 pandemic.
